structure.unit: Crimes, Punishments And Proceedingsin Criminal Cases

law.catch_line: Directed Verdict; Setting Aside Verdict, New Trial Or Finding Of Guilty Of Included Offense
law.text: If a motion for a directed verdict of not guilty is denied and the case is submitted to the jury and a verdict of guilty is returned, the judge may on a renewed motion for a directed verdict of not guilty pursuant to the Massachusetts Rules of Criminal Procedure set aside the verdict and order a new trial, or order the entry of a finding of guilty of any offense included in the offense charged in the indictment or complaint.
